Package gov.nasa.larcfm.ACCoRD

Class TargetUrgency

  • java.lang.Object
    • gov.nasa.larcfm.ACCoRD.TargetUrgency
  • public class TargetUrgency
extends java.lang.Object
    This class is used to determine if one aircraft has priority over another aircraft. It is an encapsulation of the "right of way" rules.

    Disclaimer: The current rules have been verified to have certain safety and liveness properties, but they have not been validated, that is, they may not behave "naturally." As we learn more about what is expected, these rules may evolve in the future.

    • Method Detail

      • mostUrgent

        public static boolean mostUrgent​(Detection3D cd,
                                 Vect3 so,
                                 Velocity vo,
                                 Vect3 si1,
                                 Velocity vi1,
                                 Vect3 si2,
                                 Velocity vi2,
                                 double B,
                                 double T)
        This will rank to intruders for urgency based on distance and time to conflict
        Parameters:
        cd - detection algorithm to be used -- this object may suffer side effects from the conflictDetection call, so a copy should be used
        so - ownship position
        vo - ownship velocity
        si1 - intruder1 position
        vi1 - intruder1 velocity
        si2 - intruder2 position
        vi2 - intruder2 velocity
        B - detection start time (generally 0) [relative]
        T - detection lookahead time, t <= 0 is "no data" [relative]
        Returns:
        true if intruder 1 is more urgent than intruder 2

      • sortValue

        public static double sortValue​(double cdist,
                               boolean conflict,
                               double tin,
                               double tca,
                               double dist_tca,
                               double B,
                               double T)
        Return a priority ranking value far an aircraft s.t. if two ranking values are compared, the lower (possibly negative) value will represent the most urgent aircraft.
        Parameters:
        cdist - current distance between aircraft, in meters
        conflict - true if a conflict was detected
        tin - time in for the conflict, in seconds (if conflict) [relative]
        tca - critical time of conflict, in seconds (if conflict) [relative]
        dist_tca - distance at critical time, >= 0.0 (if conflict)
        B - detection start time (generally 0) [relative]
        T - detection lookahead time, t <= 0 is "no data" [relative]
        Returns:
        urgency sorting value, with positive infinity being least urgent and negative infinity being most urgent
